titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Long Island Baptist Association records 1978.152
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-02-09 21:36:42 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: Deeds, titles, correspondence, and memos pertaining to the Long Island Baptist Association and the People's Baptist Church (also known as the Bethel Baptist Church), both located in Sag Harbor, New York.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Long Island Baptist Association records, 1978.152, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Deeds, titles, correspondence, and memos pertaining to the Long Island Baptist Association and the People's Baptist Church (also known as the Bethel Baptist Church), both located in Sag Harbor, New York. Deeds pertain to property located in the Village of Sag Harbor.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
